reviewText: 80-76%-perfect75-71%-awsome70-66%-good65-61%-poor60-56%-awful1. Road Dog vs. Big Boss Man- this was a decent match but u cant excpt alot when you are watching big boss man wrestle. Still a decent opener and i think road dog carrid this match. Winner Road Dog. Match rating 5.5/10.2. Billy Gun vs. Ken Shamrock for the Itc title- This was alot better than the first match and it was at leats for a title which made the match better. I always have like shamrock he has so much intensity and that ankle lock is deadly. Good back and forth action and i would have liked to see them go a little longer. Winner and still Itc champ Ken Shamrock. Match Rating 6.5/10.3. X-Pac vs. Gangrel for the europen title- This was a decent match. I always have liked x-pacs in ring work but i think gangrel took alot away from this ,atch and it was not that good. Worth a watch for the first time but no more than that. Winner and still europenchamp x-pac. Match Rating 6/10.4. Sable vs. Luna in a strp match for the woens title- This was a horriable match. I have always liked sable but once again luna took away from the match not much to say and u can skip this one. Winner abd still womens champ sable. Match Rating 3.5/10.5. The rock vs. Mankind for the wwe title in an i quit match- This was an unbelible match and has to be seen more than once. The punishment that mankind thakes is off the chain. This is deffenilty a top match of the year canidate, This had everthing including when mankind fell off a top of a ladder and got electrecuted, Hardcore with ladders tables nd chairs. The ending is sick were mankind is handcuffed and takes 11 chair shots to the head was hard to watch. Winner and new wwe champ the rock. Match Rating 10/10.6. The royal rumble match- This was a woerd royal rumble. It had its ups and it had its downs. Deffently not good becuase there were two people that had a decent chance of winning stone cold and vince mcmhaon . Horriable slection in this match. It was hard to watch but it was not horriable. The good thing was the ending was unpredicatrble which was a surprise and i like it. Winner Vince McMahon. Match Rating 7.5/10.Well that raps up another. I would give royal rumble 1999 a rating of 39/60 which means this is a poor ppv. Excpet for the i quit match and the royal rumble this was a awful ppv. If you can tell me if my review was helpful or not i would appreictae that. Thank u for your time.

Title: WWF: Royal Rumble 1999 - No Chance In Hell VHS

reviewText: This Royal Rumble is very memorable for many reasons. I havewatched almost all the Royal Rumbles and alot of them weren'tphysical, but this one sure stands out!!!We see a physical, hard hitting strap match between former employee/wrestler Sable -Rena Mero- and Luna.  The rivalry between the 2 has been going on for some time  and it comes to blow in this match. Both ladies take a beating and the better woman wins this match. I wont spoil it for you by saying who wins.We also see a tough match between the 300 pounds of the Big Boss Man against the Road dog in Special Challenge match. Both men beat the hell out one another and it's a good match.One memorable match is between Ken Shamrock and Billy Gunn for the IC Title. Before the match we see how this feud got started. Billy Gun proceeds to show his butt to Ken Shamrock's sister. Shamrock gets his revenge at the end.The European Match between XPac and Gangrel is also a good match but not physical like the others but still alot of high flying moves from XPAC.Speaking of high flying and physical the "I Quit" match between then Corporate Champion-The Rock, and then WWF Champion-Mankind is one of the greatest matches in WWF history even though the ending is a ripoff. We hear so much foul language in this match that I was laughing my head off, on top of that we get one of the most bloodiest matches in  history. If you have seen King of the Ring 98 between The Undertaker and Mankind, you can expect the same thing. Mick Foley sacrificing his body to put on quite a show. This is a Foley trademark and would be the subject of controversy as Foley did somewhat the dumb mistake of inviting his kids to see such a violent mess. This would be later recalled in "Beyond The Mat". Foley once said he was jealous of the Rock or implied that he was jealous certainly this wasn't his best moment but as Foley does he puts the business first.Now the Royal Rumble is also a must see because its the only Rumble where Vince McMahon is a #2 in the Rumble and Stone Cold is #1, McMahonhas put a bounty on Stone Cold, but that doesnt prevent Stone Cold from beating the hell out of Vince.A great Royal Rumble, if you havent seen any of them make sure you see this one!!!I guarantee you wont be disappointed.
Title: WWF: Royal Rumble 1999 - No Chance In Hell VHS

reviewText: This event was the WWF's first of pay per view of 1999.  In the 30-man Royal Rumble match itself, you will see Stone Cold Steve Austin come in as number 1 and Mr. Vince McMahon draw number 2.  You will also see the first  woman in a Royal Rumble match as Chyna comes in as number 30.  The WWF  Title is on the line in an "I Quit Match" as Mankind defends the  belt against the Rock.  The WWF Womens Title is on the line in a Strap  Match as Sable defends against Luna.  X-Pac defends the WWF European Title  against Gangrel.  Ken Shamrock puts up the WWF Intercontinental Title  against Badd Ass Billy Gunn.  In a special attraction non-title match, WWF  Hardcore Champion-Road Dogg Jesse James takes on the Big Boss Man.
Title: WWF: Royal Rumble 1999 - No Chance In Hell VHS

reviewText: This show I used to rent a lot back when I was 13 & 14 years old I rented it over & over & watched over & over again. I haven't seen it in 14 years so does it deliver or is it a 1 match show. This review for The Royal Rumble 1999 & is another review in my long a  *  * of old Wrestling Pay Per View reviews. Now these reviews are mainly are for people like me that grew up during The Attitude Era, people who never got to experience The Attitude Era & are interested in it or more than likely you found this review randomly. As always I like to tell the backstory with the important events leading into each Pay Per View. On The January 4th episode of RAW IS WAR Mankind defeated The Rock in a no disqualification match to win The WWF Championship. I covered this episode of RAW along with that night's WCW Nitro as part of my Good Rasslin TV series on The Pro Wrestling Forum here on amazon.  The next week on RAW IS WAR The Rock asked for a rematch at The Royal Rumble Mankind turned him down. The Rock kept adding stipulation after stipulation. Mankind kept turning him down The Rock said he quit Mankind said that's it & he made it an I Quit Match. Vince McMahon made Mankind defend The WWF title against Kane who had been forced into The Corporation & if he didn't do what Vince says then he would be sent back to The Asylum. The Rock wasn't happy about it so he interfered in that match & attacked both Kane & Mankind. The following week on RAW IS WAR The Rock jumped Mankind & gave him a Rock Bottom on a chair. Shawn Michaels made a match between The Rock & Kane cause of what happened the week before. Mankind came out & hit The Rock with a chair. On The December 14th episode of RAW IS WAR Vince & Shane McMahon drew Stone Cold Steve Austin's name for The Royal Rumble & they drew number 1 then McMahon offered $100,000 for the person that throws Stone Cold over the top rope. Then Vince entered The Royal Rumble he drew his name & he sarcastically said he hopes it's number 2 & it turned out to be number 30. During this time Shane McMahon got owned in a match with Mankind during the following week on RAW IS WAR. Commissioner Shawn Michaels held The Corporation back so the following week on RAW IS WAR Vince McMahon fired Shawn Michaels as Commissioner Shawn responded by hitting Vince with Super Kick. McMahon promised a beating. The following week on RAW IS WAR Shawn Michaels rejoined D Generation X & told Vince McMahon that he can't be fired cause when he signed the contract it stated that he answers to nobody. He also used Vince's words against him & made him enter number 2. Later on in a parking lot Shawn was beat half to death to by  Corporation members. Stone Cold Steve Austin who hadn't been seen since Rock Bottom returned & helped Mankind win The WWF title. The following week on RAW IS WAR Vince held a Corporate Royal Rumble against D Generation X for the number 30 spot. Vince thought he won it but Chyna entered Stone Cold distracted Vince allowing Chyna to throw McMahon over the top rope. Also Shane became a Personal Trainer for his Dad which you got these skits that ripped off The Rocky movies & they were funny. The December 28th episode of RAW IS WAR Dennis Knight who hadn't been seen since late September was told to be at RAW he was attacked by The Acolytes & threw in a Trunk of a Car. The next week on RAW IS WAR Dennis Knight was shown in a room yelling for help The Acolytes came & threw him into a room. The following week on RAW IS WAR Dennis Knight was yelling at Jerry Lawler & Michael Cole that he's here. The he turned out to be another man who hadn't been seen since Rock Bottom In Your House when he was buried alive The Undertaker along with Paul Bearer who gave a very satanic speech & a warning. He cut open his arm put his blood in a Goblet made Dennis Knight drink it & he said that Dennis Knight no longer exists he is now Mideon. He carved his symbol on Mideon's chest. This was the debut of The Ministry Of Darkness. On The December 14th episode of RAW IS WAR Ken Shamrock & Big Bossman beat The New Age Outlaws to win The WWF Tag Team Championship. Road Dogg & Billy Gunn went after Shamrock & Boss Man's singles titles. The Road Dogg defeated Big Boss Man to win The WWF Hardcore Championship. Billy Gunn thought that he won The WWF Intercontinental Championship but Shawn Michaels who was still heel told Gunn that it was non title. Billy Gunn went & hounded Ken Shamrock for a shot at The Intercontinental title. Ken Shamrock wouldn't give him a shot cause he said Billy Gunn was a degenerate. On The January 11th episode of RAW IS WAR Ken Shamrock attacked Val Venis cause he was making advances towards Shamrock's Sister in attendance Billy Gunn came out & mooned her Ken Shamrock then gave him a IC title shot at The Royal Rumble. The next week on RAW IS WAR Ken Shamrock put Billy Gunn in The Ankle Lock for almost a minute. On The December 28th episode of RAW IS WAR Sable was set to defend The Women's title against Spider Lady & she beat Sable up & unmasked it turned out to be Luna. On The January 17th episode of Heat Sable jumped Luna. The next night on RAW IS WAR Luna jumped Sable & whooped her with a belt which she got her title match at The Royal Rumble & it was made a Strap Match. Also on The December 14th episode of RAW IS WAR Test debuted & attacked Triple H & joined The Corporation. That's the backstory leading into this event the buyrate was a 1.88 that is up from the year before's buyrate of 0.97The champions at the time wereWWF Champion Mankind December 29th 1998 match aired January 4th 1999WWF Intercontinental Champion Ken Shamrock October 12th 1998WWF European Champion X Pac October 18th 1998WWF Tag Team Champions Ken Shamrock & The Big Boss Man December 14th 1998WWF Women's Champion Sable November 15th 1998WWF Hardcore Champion Road Dogg Jesse James December 15th 1998  match aired December 21st 1998WWF Lightheavyweight Champion Gillberg November 17th 1998 match aired November 23rd 1998Duane Gill who was champion became Gillberg on January 11th 1999Date January 24, 1999Attendance 14,816Venue Arrowhead PondCity Anaheim, CaliforniaHeatThe episode of Heat on this DVD has missing parts so I guess I should've just watched the episode on my actually Heat DVD set.The opening is great & you have this awesome production theme called Native Son used.Stone Cold Steve Austin came to the arena where he was told that he needed a Limo it's V I P only.The Corporation came out this was the 1st time Vince McMahon started using No Chance In He'  l  l.Vince put Mankind in a "tune up" match against a mystery opponent. Shane went to do commentary.A Limo pulled up outside which contained the mystery man.The JOB Squad Bob Holly & 2 Cold Scorpio Def Too Much Brian Christopher & Scott Taylor *The Acolytes & Mideon came out attacked both teams The Undertaker announced that someone else will be added to The Ministry.Backstage Mankind was sarcastically asked how it's bad he has to work twice. Mankind said he won't yell I quit but The Rock will scream I quit I quit I QUIT! Vince McMahon came back out to say Stone Cold won't be returning & he thinks he has 2nd thoughts. Just then Austin showed up in a Monster Limo drove over some cars squashed them he came down to the ring where Vince said he has 1 thing to say to him he smacked Austin in the face he got out of the ring Patterson & Brisco took Vince's beating for him.The Rock arrived at the arena he gave the bag carrier a dollar & said he was an overpaid candya  *  *.Mankind Def The Mystery Opponent who turned out to be Mable by disqualificationHeat went off the air with Patterson rubbing McMahon down with Baby Oil which was weird. McMahon said that's not Baby Oil it's Man Oil lol.Then we get to The Pay Per Viewit opens up with exclusive footage showing various wrestlers talking about The Royal Rumble MatchThe opening was goodThe Big Boss Man Def Road Dogg Jesse James * & half of a starWWF Intercontinental ChampionshipChampion Ken Shamrock Def BA Billy Gunn * & 3 quarters of a star Val Venis also interfered during the matchnow with a match that had 14 minutes they could've told a better story cause Billy Gunn was going in with a ankle injury & Shamrock didn't work on it until late in the match ok match could've been better.In the back they show Shane hyping his Dad up for The Royal Rumble Match.WWF European ChampionshipChampion X Pac Def Gangrel * & quarter of a star a poor match but they did their best for a short length of time they had to go with.Kevin Kelly interviewed DX Triple H said that DX was tight as any group but tonight it's for a shot at The WWF Championship it's every man for himself Chyna added & women.Strap Match for The WWF Women's ChampionshipChampion  Sable Def Luna half a starShane McMahon wanted Sable to forfit the title. She was hurt by Luna Tori not Torrie Wilson interfered & helped Sable while Shane was distracting The Referee.I heard a shoot interview from 2002 with Luna & Gangrel & Luna said that she was promised The Women's title 3 times Sable didn't want to take bumps & I have heard she had a bad attitude from various people who were in The WWF at the time. Jim Cornette who I don't care for as person on The Timeline DVD 1997 DVD I have he said she didn't want to take bumps & he also said to Sable it's not ballet sister. Sable would be gone in 4 months & file a lawsuit against McMahon so a lot of good putting in all that time in Sable when you Luna who listening to all the BS she went through putting Sable over I feel so sorry for her.A really good video package was shown for The I Quit WWF title match between The Rock & Mankind.Dok Hendrix interviewed The Rock who cut a great promo.I Quit MatchWWF ChampionshipThe Rock Def Champion Mankind **** in a great match to regain the title. This match if you don't know well you should it was high profile cause it got a lot of play mainly in that documentary Beyond The Mat cause Foley's Wife & Kids were in the 1st row & his Kids I think were too young not to understand that this wasn't real & imagine what was going through their heads seeing 2 men you think are friends beat the f  *  *  k out of each other. This match badly needed Jim Ross who was still recovering from Bells Palsey cause Michael Cole is horrible in this match. In fact Michael Cole here makes Cole later on look like Gordon Solie.Awesome video package was shown for The Royal Rumble MatchRoyal Rumble MatchVince McMahon won last eliminating Stone Cold Steve Austin when The Rock came out & distracted Stone Cold*** & quarter of a starDuring the match McMahon escaped through the crowd Austin chased after him to The Women's Bathroom where he jumped by The Corporation Austin was sent to The Hospital. Vince came back later on to provide commentary. Austin returned in The Ambulance that he stole later on & McMahon's reactions when Austin returned to the arena made me smile.The Ministry Of Darkness captured Mable.The Match also involved Golga, Droz, Edge, Gillberg, Steve Blackman, Dan "The Beast" Severn, Tiger Ali Singh, The Blue Meanie, Mable attacked Mosh & took his spot. Road Dogg Jesse James, Gangrel, Kurrgan, Al Snow, Goldust, The Godfather, Kane, Ken Shamrock, Billy Gunn, Test, Big Boss Man, Triple H, Val Venis, X Pac, Mark Henry, Jeff Jarrett, D'Lo Brown, Owen Hart & Chyna.This wasn't a great or even a good Rumble. It was predictable even back then I was like either Vince McMahon or Stone Cold were going to win & you look at the group of people in The Rumble did anyone really think these guys had any momentum or were interesting. I'll admit that Triple H had momentum but that's it. It was a good booking angle advancement Royal Rumble to further The Austin vs McMahon storyline. Kind of like The Royal Rumble 1997 was just a booking & the victory was overturned then & Shawn Michaels overturned McMahon's victory the next day on RAW. The Rock & Austin fought their way to the back. McMahon, Pat Patterson,  Gerald Brisco & Shane came out to celebrate with Vince & Vince mimiced Austin & drank some beer.So pretty much an avoidable under card a great WWF title match & a Royal Rumble that was a good angle advancement not much else just watch the last 2 matches you don't need to buy this unless you see The VHS in a pawn shop or get a bootleg DVD but nothing you need to see right away mediocre 1st Pay Per View of 1999. As I said back in Royal Rumble 97 review the good old days weren't always good.
summary: WWF Royal Rumble 1999 review 5/10 finally published on 3/28/14
Title: WWF: Royal Rumble 1999 - No Chance In Hell VHS

reviewText: The Royal Rumble match was a fun,hard-hitting & entertaining bout even with the lousy ending. The "I Quit" match for the world title between The Rock & Mankind was a hardcore,blood-spilling,heart-stopping & nail-biting match of the year. The rest were pretty good/solid matches. I give this PPV a 10 out of 10.
Title: WWF: Royal Rumble 1999 - No Chance In Hell VHS

reviewText: This PPV had some up's and downs but it was not forced down you throat.  The Royal Rumble match was awesome until somebody you don't expect to win does.Mankind vs. The Rock for the World Title in an I Quit Match.  This was a good match but Foley had his hands tieed behind his back for a while.  Mankind never said "I Quit" but The Rock still won the match and the title. (4/5)Ken Shamrock vs. Bad A$$ Billy Gunn for the IC Title.  This was a good match but at least it was clean.  Shamrock retains the title when Billy taps out to the Ankle Lock. (3/5)Sable vs. Luna for the Women's Title in a Strap Match.  This match was utterly horrible.  The only reason it doesn't get a complete zero is because it was a strap match and they just whacked each other.  Sable retains the title. (0.5/5)Big Boss Man vs. Road Dogg was stupid because it was not for the Hardcore Title.  It was not very pleasent.  Boss Man picks up the win. (1.5/5)X-Pac vs. Gangrel for the European Title.  This match was good but it could have been so much better.  I thought Gangrel was gonna win but X-Pac somehow retains. (2.5/5)Royal Rumble Match was so dumb.  Why in God's name do you have VINCE MCMAHON winning the Royal Rumble.  I don't care if Austin won again but why Vince?  This match was just bad. (2/5)When the Royal Rumble doesn't have a good Rumble match don't get it and the same thing with this PPV.
Title: WWF: Royal Rumble 1999 - No Chance In Hell VHS

reviewText: For those of you that have the movie "Beyond the Mat", you should get this video. It serves as a nice complement to the Royal Rumble Foley/Rock scenes from Beyond the Mat to the actual Foley/Rock match.As far as the tape itself, when not viewed in the context of "Beyond the Mat" --- I still say get it for the Foley/Rock match. The rest of the show pretty much paled in comparison to the show-stealing brutal match the two had. This was during the latter part of the WWF's Vince Russo - Ed Ferrera "We're Not About Wrestling Anymore" era, which came under tremendous criticism from wrestling fans everywhere. The product has changed significantly enough for the better since then.I would get this video along with "Beyond the Mat"... they go very well together.
Title: WWF: Royal Rumble 1999 - No Chance In Hell VHS

reviewText: I have been a fan of the WWE for many years now, and I have seen a lot of Royal Rumble pay-per-views. The 1999 Royal Rumble was one of the better ones that I have seen. While the majority of the card featured nothing special, this Royal Rumble is worth owning for two outstanding matches. The first is obviously the Royal Rumble itself. Vince McMahon himself competed in the match. One thing I really liked about this video, was the fact that it shows Vince's different training regements. You see him lifting weights, drinking raw eggs, chasing after a live chicken, etc. It is some of the funniest stuff that you will ever see. The match itself was extremely well done, and I loved the ending. The second match is the "I Quit" match between The Rock and Mankind for the WWE title. This has to be one of my all time favorite matches. It is by far the most brutal WWE title match I have ever seen. Seeing Mic Foley take chair shot after chair shot to the head made me actually cringe. The thing that made it really brutal, was the fact that Mic's wife and children were sitting in the audience. They were actually brought to tears.Overall, the 1999 Royal Rumble deserves a solid 4 stars. The pay-per-view as a whole is not very well rounded and you spend the whole time wanting to fast forward to the last two matches on the card. However, the match between The Rock and Mankind, and the Royal Rumble itself make the show an enjoyable one.
Title: WWF: Royal Rumble 1999 - No Chance In Hell VHS

reviewText: The Rock vs. Mankind was the only good match on the show. Everything else was worthless. The Rumble was absolutely terrible. If you want The Rock vs. Mankind, order a comp, don't waste your money on this.
Title: WWF: Royal Rumble 1999 - No Chance In Hell VHS

reviewText: I attended Royal Rumble: No Chance In Hell. While the undercards were ok, the "I Quit" match between The Rock and Mankind was unbeliveable. The bump that Mick Foley took was unreal and the way The Rock laided the  smack down was truly worth watching. You have to see it to live to belive  it. The actual Royal Rumble was not bad with an ending nobody really  expected. This video is worth it.
summary: You had to have been there to know what it was like
Title: WWF: Royal Rumble 1999 - No Chance In Hell VHS

reviewText: The 1999 Royal Rumble was suprisingly not that good as I expected. Here are the matches.1. Road Dogg vs. Big Boss Man 6/10Not a good way to start the pay-per-view. Not good because it did not have Hardcore Rules.2. Ken Shamrock vs. Billy Gunn 7/10A little better than the first but this match was still not satisfying.3. X-Pac vs. Gangrel 8/10First good match of the night. Very fast pace one too, but I did not like the ending. I wanted Gangrel to be the new European champ but that did not happen.4. Sable vs. Luna (Strap Match) 5/10The worst match of the night. It is a lttle pointless but it is not as terrible as some of the other reviewers say it is.5. The Rock vs. Mankind (I Quit match) 10/10The BEST match of the night. These two guys sacrificed everything (especially Mankind). It is a little too hardcore because Mankind was bleeding non-stop, Mankind was hit with a chair many many times, and Mankind almost got electricuted. I did not like the ending though. This match was crazy.6. The Royal Rumble Match 8/10Good match, but the ring was clear most of the match. I actually kind of liked the ending when Vince wins because it caught me by suprise, and I like getting surprised. That makes it predictable and then unpredictable. Some of the highlights were Mabel, Kane, and Stone Cold Steve Austin clearing the ring at least at one point in the match. Chyna (who was number 30) eliminated Mark Henry too!!
Title: WWF: Royal Rumble 1999 - No Chance In Hell VHS

reviewText: While most of this pay-per-view is pretty dull, the one match that truly stands out is the "I Quit" match between The Rock and Mankind. This match never seems to get old since I still watch it quite often. This match was quite controversial during its time because of the profanity and surpisingly savage violence! With that being said, I would not recommend this match for the easily offended. The Rock hand cuffs Mankind with his hands behind his back and relentlessly beats him over the head with a solid steel chair! This match will always be a classic but the rest of the pay-per-view is lame. Get this video for the "I Quit" matchup...YOU WON'T REGRET IT!
summary: THE MOST BRUTAL WWF CHAMPIONSHIP MATCH OF 1999!
Title: WWF: Royal Rumble 1999 - No Chance In Hell VHS

reviewText: Road Dogg vs Big Boss Manno idea why this wasnt a title match it would have been so much better if it was for the title and had hardcore rules bad match,bossman wins.(1/5)(intercontnental championship)Ken Shamrock(champ) vs Billy Gunnthis was an ok match,some nice wrestling moves used,wished the title changed hands.(3/5)(european championship match)X-pac(champ) vs Gangrelthis wasnt a too bad of a match not the greatest x-pac retains his title(3/5)(womens championship strap match)Sable(champ) vs Lunawaste of time!!sable retains title(0/5)(WWF championship I-quit match)The Rock vs Mankind(champ)this wasnt too bad of a match the rock had to cheat becuase mankind would never say i quit but i was happy the rock won some big bumps taken by both men(4/5)The royal rumble matchi hated this royal rumble it was awful mcmahon wins?? one of the worst ppvs everi do not recommend this video i wasted my 35$ watching it live and it was not worth it a couple matches saved it from being 1 star!
